Full_Description: Progressive fartlek workout with descending intervals: 5min, 4min, 3min, 2min, 1min hard efforts with half-time recovery jogs between each interval.
Key_Points: • Start at tempo effort (5min) and progress to 800m pace (1min)|• Recovery jogs are HALF the time of the hard effort|• Example: 5min hard, 2:30 jog, 4min hard, 2min jog, etc.|• Total hard time: 15 minutes|• Focus on negative splitting each interval
Pace_Info: 5min: M/T pace, 4min: 5k pace, 3min: 3k pace, 2min: Mile pace, 1min: 800m pace

Full_Description: Continuous hill running for 20min. Hard effort up the hill, recovery pace down the hill
Continuous hill running for 25min. Hard effort up the hill, recovery pace down the hill
Continuous hill running for 30min. Hard effort up the hill, recovery pace down the hill
Continuous hill running for 35min. Hard effort up the hill, recovery pace down the hill
Continuous hill running for 40min. Hard effort up the hill, recovery pace down the hill
Long run starting easy and progressing to moderate/tempo effort in final portion. Build gradually throughout.
Key_Points: • First 60-70% at easy/conversational pace|• Middle 20-25% at steady/moderate pace|• Final 10-15% at tempo effort|• No specific splits - run by feel|• Focus on relaxed form throughout
Pace_Info: Start: Easy pace, Finish: M-T pace

Full_Description: Sustained threshold effort for 20 minutes. 'Comfortably hard' pace you could hold for about an hour in a race.
Key_Points: • Start controlled - don't go out too fast|• Should feel comfortably hard throughout|• Breathing: rhythmic but labored|• Focus on relaxed shoulders and efficient stride|• This is NOT a time trial - steady effort

Full_Description: Sustained threshold effort for 25 minutes. 'Comfortably hard' pace you could hold for about an hour in a race.
Key_Points: • Start controlled - don't go out too fast|• Should feel comfortably hard throughout|• Breathing: rhythmic but labored|• Focus on relaxed shoulders and efficient stride|• This is NOT a time trial - steady effort

Full_Description: 4 x 200m accelerations with full recovery. Build to 85-90% effort, focusing on form and relaxation.
Key_Points: • Gradual acceleration over first 50m|• Hold smooth, relaxed speed for middle 100m|• Gradual deceleration over final 50m|• Walk back to start between reps|• Focus: form, not speed

Full_Description: 6 x 200m accelerations with full recovery. Build to 85-90% effort, focusing on form and relaxation.
Key_Points: • Gradual acceleration over first 50m|• Hold smooth, relaxed speed for middle 100m|• Gradual deceleration over final 50m|• Walk back to start between reps|• Focus: form, not speed

Full_Description: Conversational pace run for aerobic base building. Should be able to speak in complete sentences.
Key_Points: • True easy effort - don't push the pace|• This builds your aerobic engine

Full_Description: Run the specified number of laps alternating pace every 200m.
Key_Points: • NO stopping between 400s - continuous workout|• First 200m of each lap: Pre 30 pace (faster)|• Second 200m of each lap: Pre 40 pace (slower)|• Focus on smooth transitions between paces|• Hit your assigned paces from chart - don't guess|• Number of reps depends on your group assignment|• This builds speed endurance and pace change ability
Pace_Info: See Pre 30/40 pace chart for your specific paces
